paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: How long wilt thou forget me, O LORD? for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How long wilt thou forget me, O Lord? for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?

paragraphs.content: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?

paragraphs.content: Consider and hear me, O LORD my God: lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Consider and hear me, O Lord my God: lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;

paragraphs.content: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.

paragraphs.content: But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.

paragraphs.content: I will sing unto the LORD, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will sing unto the Lord, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.
